sources.title: Circumstantial Evidence
sources.description: Title: Circumstantial Evidence Summary: A reporter sets out to provide how unreliable circumstantial evidence is by faking a murder and then taking the rap for it. However, the "fake" murder victim turns out to be really dead. Directed by: Charles Lamont Actors: Chick Chandler, Shirley Grey, Arthur Vinton Production Company: Chesterfield Motion Pictures Corporation (I) Release Date: 30 March 1935 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 A reporter sets out to provide how unreliable circumstantial evidence is by faking a murder and then taking the rap for it. However, the "fake" murder victim turns out to be really dead.

sources.title: Circumstantial Evidence (1935) SHIRLEY GREY
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars:  Shirley Grey, Chick Chandler, Arthur Vinton
Director: Charles Lamont

An ambitious reporter sets out to prove how unreliable circumstantial evidence is by faking a murder and taking the rap for it. However, when his hoax backfires, he finds himself sentenced to the gallows.
